Macaque and MK huddled behind a rock as the sounds of battle intensified. They could hear the clash of weapons, the sound of fists hitting flesh, and the occasional roar of a monkey. Macaque closed his eyes and focused on his magic, trying to summon as much power as he could.

"Stay behind me," he said to MK, who nodded silently. "We have to be ready for anything."

Suddenly, the sounds of battle stopped. Macaque opened his eyes and cautiously peeked over the rock. He could see Wukong and Nezha standing facing each other, both panting heavily. Nezha's armor was dented and his weapon looked like it had taken a beating, but he still stood tall and confident.

"You can't beat me, Wukong," Nezha said, his voice steady despite his exhaustion. "I'm here to take back what you stole."

Wukong growled and bared his teeth. "I didn't steal anything. Everything I have, I took by my own strength."

"That's not true," Nezha replied. "You stole the immortality pills from the Queen Mother of the West. You're not supposed to have them, and you know it."

Wukong hesitated for a moment, his face contorting with anger. "So what if I did?" he shouted. "I deserve them more than anyone else. I'm the Great Sage Equal to Heaven! I'm unstoppable!"

Macaque frowned and stepped out from behind the rock, his hands crackling with magic. "You're not unstoppable, Wukong," he said. "And you're not invincible. We've all seen that now."

Wukong turned to face him, his eyes blazing with fury. "You think you're so clever, Macaque," he sneered. "But you're just a weak, pathetic monkey. You can't even stand up to me, let alone defeat me."

Macaque didn't flinch. "I may be weaker than you, Wukong, but I have something you don't," he said. "I have honor. And I have friends who will stand by me, no matter what."

Wukong snorted. "Friends? You mean that worthless human boy? He's nothing. He's not even worth the trouble it took to capture him."

MK stepped out from behind the rock as well, his eyes blazing with defiance. "I'm not worthless," he said. "And neither is Macaque. You're the one who's weak, Wukong. You're weak because you're afraid to face your own flaws. You're afraid to admit that you're not perfect, that you can be defeated. But you know what? That's what makes us strong. The ability to admit our mistakes and learn from them."

Wukong glared at MK, his fists clenching. For a moment, it looked like he was going to attack, but then he hesitated. "You think you're so smart, don't you?" he said. "But you don't know anything. You don't know what it's like to be powerful, to be respected, to be feared. You're just a weak little boy, and you always will be."

MK stood his ground, his eyes locked on Wukong's. "Maybe I am just a weak little boy," he said. "But I'm not afraid to stand up to bullies like you. And I'm not afraid to fight for what's right."

Wukong stared at him for a moment longer, and then he turned and stormed off, his monkeys following him. MK and Macaque watched him go, their hearts pounding.

Wukong stormed into the alcove cage, his face contorted in anger. Without hesitation, he threw Macaque aside and lunged at MK, grabbing him by the throat and lifting him off the ground.

"You're not going anywhere this time," Wukong snarled. "I won't have you be rescued again."

MK gasped for air, trying to free himself from Wukong's grip. He could feel his heart pounding in his chest as he realized the gravity of the situation. This time, there was no one coming to save him.

"Wukong, please!" Macaque cried out, trying to intervene. "Don't do this!"

But Wukong was too far gone. He ignored Macaque and focused all his attention on MK.

"You were fun while it lasted," Wukong sneered. "But now it's time for you to pay for your crimes."

MK's mind raced as he struggled to break free, but it was no use. He was completely at Wukong's mercy.

"Please... I didn't mean to do anything wrong," MK gasped, his voice barely audible. "I didn't know..."

Wukong's grip tightened, cutting off MK's words.

"It doesn't matter," Wukong growled. "You knew enough to betray me. And now, you'll pay the price."

MK's eyes widened in terror as he realized Wukong was going to kill him. He looked over at Macaque, who was standing a few feet away, helpless.

This was it, MK thought. This was the end.

MK gasps for breath as Wukong's powerful grip tightens around his throat. He struggles and tries to break free, but Wukong's strength is too much for him.

"You were fun," Wukong says with a cruel grin, "but I won't let you be rescued again. It's time for you to pay for your insolence."

MK's eyes widen in terror as he realizes what Wukong intends to do. He manages to gasp out a plea. "Please, Wukong, don't kill me. I'll do anything, I swear."

But Wukong just laughs. "Anything? You're in no position to bargain with me, little monkey."

MK's vision starts to blur as the lack of oxygen to his brain takes its toll. He feels his life slipping away and knows that he has to do something, anything, to survive.

With a last burst of strength, he reaches up and grabs Wukong's arm, digging his nails into the flesh. Wukong howls in pain and releases his grip on MK's throat.

MK falls to the ground, gasping and coughing, but relieved to be alive. Wukong glares down at him, his eyes filled with rage.

"You'll pay for that, monkey," Wukong growls. "I promise you that."

MK shudders in fear, but also feels a glimmer of hope. He knows that he can't give up, that he has to keep fighting if he wants to survive.

Macaque's body ripples with energy as he steps between Wukong and MK. "You won't lay a hand on him," he growls, his eyes glowing with power.

Wukong snarls and charges at Macaque, their bodies colliding with a resounding boom. They trade blows, neither gaining the upper hand. Meanwhile, MK clings to Macaque's fur, feeling the strength of the monkey's muscles as he runs.

Macaque spins around, putting his back to the cage door. "Hold on tight," he says to MK, his voice strained as he fights off Wukong's attacks. "We're getting out of here."

MK nods, burying his face in Macaque's fur. He feels the heat of Wukong's breath on his back and knows that the demon is getting closer. But Macaque fights on, his body glowing with power as he holds Wukong at bay.

Finally, with a mighty roar, Macaque shoves Wukong back and makes a break for the door. MK can see the light streaming in from outside, and he feels a surge of hope.

But as they reach the door, a massive hand snatches at Macaque's tail, causing him to stumble. MK tumbles to the ground, rolling away from Wukong's grasp. He scrambles to his feet and turns to see Wukong standing over him, his eyes filled with rage.

"You can't run from me," Wukong snarls. "I'll always find you."

But just as Wukong reaches for him, a bright light envelops the alcove. MK shields his eyes, and when he looks back, Wukong is gone.

Macaque limps over to MK, his body battered and bruised. "Are you all right?" he asks, concern etched on his face.

MK nods, still in shock. "What...what just happened?"

"That was my last resort," Macaque says, his voice quiet. "I summoned the power of the universe to banish Wukong. He won't be back for a long time."

MK stares at Macaque in awe, realizing for the first time just how powerful the monkey really is. "Thank you," he says softly. "Thank you for saving my life."

Macaque smiles, his eyes twinkling with mischief. "It was nothing," he says. "Just another day in the life of a monkey king."
